channel.title: RSS Aggregator Feed
channel.description: An aggregated feed of Technology-related news

item.title: Tesla discontinues Autopilot in bid to boost adoption of its Full Self-Driving software
item.description: The company is also currently facing a 30-day suspension of its manufacturing and dealer licenses in California for deceptive marketing about Autopilot's capabilities.

item.title: Crowdstrike and Nord Security partnership nests Falcon Go and Falcon Enterprise directly through NordLayer – combined enterprise-grade protection with VPN and ZTNA for SMBs
item.description: CrowdStrike and Nord Security partner to bring enterprise-grade security to small and medium businesses.

item.title: « Une chance inouïe » : les astronomes ont vu l’avalanche qui déclenche les éruptions solaires, et bien plus encore !
item.description: Une tempête solaire a enflammé notre ciel en ce début de semaine. Aujourd’hui, deux missions spatiales nous révèlent quelques-uns des secrets des colères du Soleil. Les avalanches magnétiques qui déclenchent ses éruptions. Et d’autres observations inattendues…

item.title: Apple accuses Europe of 'delay tactics' following alternative app store collapse
item.description: Following the shutdown of an alternative app store, Apple has accused the European Commission (EC) of using “political delay tactics” as an excuse to probe and fine the company, Bloomberg reported. Apple issued the statement preemptively as commission is reportedly preparing to blame Apple for the shutdown of third-party app store Setapp due to what the developer called “still-evolving and complex business terms.”As part of an EU ruling, Apple was forced to allow third-party marketplaces for apps once the Digital Markets Act (DMA) took effect in 2024. Apple agreed to allow such stores, but imp...

item.title: The deal to keep TikTok in the US is now finalized – here are 5 things you need to know
item.description: A new US-led consortium is taking control of TikTok in the United States, but original owner ByteDance is still involved.

item.title: Best Buy's Presidents' Day preview sale is live — here are 35 deals I'd buy on TVs, appliances, laptops and more
item.description: Best Buy's weekend sale is like a Presidents' Day preview, and I'm rounding up 35 deals I recommend buying now, including appliances, TVs, laptops, Apple devices, and more.

item.title: I test vacuums for a living – these are the 3 best cheap stick vacuums you can buy
item.description: All of these vacuums deliver reliable, efficient cleaning without breaking the bank – with prices starting as low as £169.99.

item.title: Elon Musk Isn’t an Optimist, He’s a Salesman
item.description: At Davos, Musk sold a vision of himsel that doesn't align with reality.

item.title: Roborock Qrevo Curv 2 Flow Review: The Most Beautiful, Best Robot Vacuum
item.description: Roborock hasn’t updated its popular, affordable Qrevo Curv line of robovacs for years. Finally, it’s happening!

item.title: Forza Horizon 6's Developer Direct showcase was brilliant — these three big changes are what excite me most about the upcoming open-world racing game, but potential genAI usage has me concerned
item.description: Better player housing, touge battles, and iconic Japanese street racing locales — yep, Forza Horizon 6 looks pretty exceptional.

item.title: The Morning After: Apple might be making its own AirTag-sized AI wearable
item.description: It’s been a while since rumors and reports suggested Apple is exploring a new divisive product category, and it’s been several years since the Apple car. Unfortunately, the new challenger is a wearable AI pin with cameras, mics and… zero interest from me.According to a report from The Information, it’ll resemble a slightly thicker AirTag with an aluminum and glass exterior. The report suggests it’ll have two cameras (standard and wide-angle) for photos and video. It may also have three microphones and a (swoon) physical button. I love a physical button.TMAAppleHow is Apple going to pitch it? W...

item.title: Three sales secrets from the stage that translate into everyday leadership
item.description: A charity auctioneer shares her tricks of the trade. I like to say that my job as a charity auctioneer is the ultimate sales role. I stand onstage night after night encouraging people to give money, playing off the audience to push them to bid higher, in the name of charity. If there’s one thing the stage has taught me, it’s that flexibility is everything. The faster you can adapt and offer a solution, the more successful you’ll be whether you’re selling a product or an idea. Here are three of my favorite sales secrets....

item.title: One game surprised me the most in the Xbox Developer Direct — and it's a wacky brawler that's releasing this year
item.description: Xbox Game Studios has revealed Kiln, a pottery brawler from the team behind Keeper and Psychonauts 2.

item.title: Major Microsoft 365 outage left users without access to emails and files - here's what we know
item.description: Business customers were left without access to Microsoft 365 core services for several hours, but functionality is now restored.

item.title: ‘Wonder Man’ May Be Marvel’s Best Show Yet
item.description: Yahya Abdul-Mateen II and Sir Ben Kingsley star in the Marvel show, which debuts January 27 on Disney+.

item.title: No, the Freecash App Won’t Pay You to Scroll TikTok
item.description: Freecash will actually pay money out to users but not for watching videos. This misleading marketing coincides with the app’s rising popularity.

item.title: Google won’t stop replacing our news headlines with terrible AI
item.description: In early December, I brought you the news that Google has begun replacing Verge headlines, and those of our competitors, with AI clickbait nonsense in its content feed. Google appeared to be backing away from the experiment, but now tells The Verge that its AI headlines in Google Discover are a feature, one that "performs […]

item.title: 'It's a risk': Wonder Man showrunner says the new Disney+ show is a 'big swing' for Marvel — and could 'alienate' some of the comic giant's hardcore fans
item.description: Wonder Man's co-creator has had his say on how fans might react to Marvel's next Disney+ TV series.

item.title: How AI is redefining accuracy at the X Games
item.description: Sports are entering a new era and it could be powered by artificial intelligence. Jeremy Bloom, CEO of the X Games, is placing a bold bet on AI to revolutionize how competitions are judged and scored. From reducing human error to enhancing fairness and accuracy, AI judges could redefine the future of professional sports. But […] Sports are entering a new era and it could be powered by artificial intelligence. Jeremy Bloom, CEO of the X Games, is placing a bold bet on AI to revolutionize how competitions are judged and scored. From reducing human error to enhancing fairness and accuracy, AI jud...

item.title: Why AI can’t automate science, according to a philosopher
item.description: While AI can assist in tasks that are part of the scientific process, it’s still far away from automating science—and may never be able to. Consistent with the general trend of incorporating artificial intelligence into nearly every field, researchers and politicians are increasingly using AI models trained on scientific data to infer answers to scientific questions. But can AI ultimately replace scientists?...

item.title: You can finally see the Met Opera outside NYC: These movie theaters are showing ‘Kavalier and Clay’ this weekend
item.description: The performing arts company’s production is based on a Michael Chabon book and set during World War II. Here’s where you can catch a screening. If one of your New Year’s resolutions was to spend less time on devices and get more “cultured,” the Metropolitan Opera is here to help—even if you don’t find yourself in New York City.

item.title: Tesla lance ses premiers robotaxis 100 % autonomes, mais il y a un hic
item.description: C'est une étape symbolique pour Tesla. Les premiers robotaxis sans aucun superviseur humain circulent désormais à Austin. Si Elon Musk crie victoire, la comparaison avec Waymo reste cruelle pour le constructeur.

item.title: Fnac et Darty mettent en solde l’excellent casque Sony WH-1000XM6
item.description: Le Sony WH-1000XM6 est un modèle qui frôle la perfection. Sa réduction de bruit est d'une efficacité redoutable, le confort, exemplaire, et l’endurance impressionnante. S'il vous intéresse, il est en ce moment en soldes à 379 euros au lieu de 450 euros.

item.title: NYT Mini crossword answers, hints for January 23, 2026
item.description: Answers to each clue for the January 23, 2026 edition of NYT's The Mini crossword puzzle.

item.title: We Are Rewind GB-001 Cassette Boombox: Old-School Stylish
item.description: We Are Rewind’s speaker/cassette player combo is an imperfect but satisfying reissue of a bygone audio era.

item.title: Samsung dégaine de belles offres juste avant le weekend des soldes : les 18 deals à ne pas louper
item.description: C'est le week-end, et c’est le moment parfait pour profiter de la 3ᵉ démarque des soldes ! Samsung sort le grand jeu avec des réductions impressionnantes : smartphones pliables comme le Galaxy Z Flip 7, TV OLED en forte baisse, ou encore vidéoprojecteu à prix cassés. De quoi se faire plaisir avant le week-end sans faire exploser son budget !

item.title: Gboard : le clavier Google ajoute un petit changement qui fait une énorme différence
item.description: Google vient d'ajouter à Gboard un raccourci qui pourrait faire gagner un temps fou à tous les utilisateurs du clavier, aussi bien sur Android que sur iOS.

item.title: Fable director explains what makes the RPG a fairytale rather than a straight fantasy like The Witcher — 'Fairytales are intimate, they’re small stories about regular people... I think that is a brilliant description of what Fable really is'
item.description: According to Fable game director Ralph Fulton, the upcoming game will be an open-world fairytale, rather than a "grand and sweeping" fantasy story like The Witcher or Skyrim.

item.title: Soldes d’hiver 2026 : la 3ème démarque continue avec de belles pépites juste avant le week-end
item.description: Cela fait déjà plus de deux semaines que les soldes d'hiver ont commencé en France et que les e-commerçants tels qu'Amazon, Fnac, Darty, Boulanger ou encore Cdiscount partagent des offres. C'est maintenant l'heure de la 3e démarque et voici les meilleures offres Tech à saisir.

item.title: Microsoft Paint can now make AI coloring books
item.description: Microsoft is giving its Paint and Notepad apps on Windows new AI capabilities for editing text and making digital illustrations. The updates are currently rolling out to Windows Insiders in the Windows 11 Canary and Dev channels, and include features that feel oddly niche or advanced for such simplified apps, such as AI text improvements […]

item.title: Whatever is happening in Teyana Taylor and Geeses SNL teaser, Ill buy it
item.description: Teyana Taylor, Geese, and Marcello Hernández promote their upcoming "SNL" show and it's wonderfully weird.

item.title: EU issued over €1.2bn in GDPR fines in 2025 as multiple data breaches bite
item.description: Although the GDPR fine value was slightly higher in 2025, the number of personal data breach reports rose even more.

item.title: Cyberattaque en cours sur Facebook : des hackers cherchent à pirater votre compte
item.description: Une cyberattaque d'envergure vise Facebook. En promettant un faux badge bleu, les cybercriminels cherchent à s'emparer de votre compte. Pour arriver à leurs fins sans se faire repérer, ils réclament d'abord vos cookies de session.

item.title: C’est fini pour l’ID.4 : Volkswagen confirme son changement radical de stratégie pour ses voitures électriques
item.description: Les rumeurs bruissaient, c'est désormais confirmé : le Volkswagen ID.4 va se renommer en ID. Tiguan à l'occasion d'un profond restylage courant 2026. Une confirmation de la nouvelle nomenclature des voitures électriques de la marque, après l'ID. Polo.

item.title: Amazon just made a massive change to Kindle ebooks that lets you read them anywhere, but there's a catch
item.description: Amazon has just added a DRM-free option to Kindle ebooks, letting you read them anywhere. But publishers need to opt in first.

item.title: 149 Million Usernames and Passwords Exposed by Unsecured Database
item.description: This “dream wish list for criminals” includes millions of Gmail, Facebook, banking logins, and more. The researcher who discovered it suspects they were collected using infostealing malware.

item.title: Why you should stop relying on self-discipline and do this instead
item.description: Focusing too much on it can lead to burnout and exhaustion. We hear a lot about self-discipline in today’s productivity-obsessed culture. And the message is usually that it’s the cure for economic insecurity and a pathway to self-actualization. At first glance, this appears to make sense. But it can be a double-edged sword in our modern work lives and always-on culture....

item.title: This battery company from MIT helps factories ditch fossil fuels for cheap renewable power
item.description: Electrified Thermal Solutions’ battery tech can provide heat up to 1,800 degrees Celsius—and help industries like steel and cement run on electricity. Most factories still run on fossil fuels, whether they’re making potato chips or steel. But a new “thermal battery” could make it cheaper to do the same work with clean energy.

item.title: Why the Minnesota National Guard is being forced to dress like crossing guards
item.description: As officers from federal agencies flood the Twin Cities, it has become impossible for citizens to know who is there to do what. The announcement earlier this week that the Minnesota National Guard was standing by to assist local law enforcement and public safety agencies in and around Minneapolis-St. Paul included a surprising detail. “If our members are activated,” it read, “they will be wearing reflective vests … to help distinguish them from other agencies in similar uniforms.”...

item.title: This tech could keep EVs from stressing the grid—and save everyone money
item.description: Instead of lots of EVs juicing up their huge batteries all at once, ‘active managed charging’ distributes the load throughout the night, helping stabilize the grid. If you’re a typical American, you get home from work and start flipping switches and turning knobs—doing laundry, cooking dinner, watching TV. With so many other folks doing the same, the strain on the electrical grid in residential areas is highest at this time. That demand will only grow as the world moves away from fossil fuels, with more people buying induction stoves, heat pumps, and electric vehicles....
